intro: Pertya macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf pertya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by bright red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Pertya macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique fruit.
